conclusion: Objects A and B are held in the air, and objects C, D, E, and F are placed on a table with two cloths, one plaid and one blue.
Gravity will pull objects A and B towards the table, causing them to come into contact with objects C, D, E, and F.
The cloths on the table are not fixed in place, so when objects A and B are placed on the table, they will apply pressure to the cloths.
The force from objects A and B will cause the cloths to shift or move.
The movement of the cloths will reveal the objects underneath, as the cloths are not secured.
The cloths will slide to the sides, revealing the objects underneath.
